introduction: In a very short amount of time the human population exploded and is still growing very fast. Will th

vocabulary.definition: a prediction of what will happen in the future
vocabulary.example: Many believed the prophecy that the world would end in 2012.

vocabulary.definition: the act of setting free from legal, social, or political restrictions; liberation
vocabulary.example: The Emancipation Proclamation in the United States freed slaves in Confederate states during the Civil War.

vocabulary.definition: describing or prophesying the complete destruction of the world
vocabulary.example: The scientist warned of an apocalyptic event caused by climate change.

vocabulary.definition: a situation in which the number of people in an area exceeds the capacity of the environment to support life at a decent standard of living
vocabulary.example: Overpopulation in urban areas can lead to traffic congestion and strain on resources.

vocabulary.definition: relating to the structure of populations, including size, composition, and distribution
vocabulary.example: The government studied the demographic trends to plan for future healthcare needs.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to produce offspring; the capacity to conceive or induce conception
vocabulary.example: The clinic offers treatments to help couples struggling with fertility issues.
